shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Anaphoras (fols. 1ra – 84vb) I-1) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus (fols. 1ra l.1–3ra l.13), incomplete, the beginning is missing I-2) Anaphora of St. Athanasius (fols. 3rb l.1-20ra l.11) I-3) Anaphora of St. John, Son of Thunder (fols. 21ra l.1–34rb l.2) I-4) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 34rb l.3–40ra l.8) I-5) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 40ra l.9–49ra l.13) I-6) An excerpt from the Testamentum Domini (ʾƎmmäṣḥafä kidan zä-nägäromu lä-ḥawaryat, cp. MQ, IV, Qǝddase ʾǝgziʾ, §§1-17); Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 49rb l.1–55va l.2) I-7) Anaphora of St. Gregory of Nyssa (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 55va, l.3–61va l.6) I-8) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 61vb l.1–70ra l.6) I-9) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius (fols. 70rb, l.1–75rb l.10) I-10) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 75va l.1–80ra l.2). Not inscribed with the saint’s name I-11) The second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 80ra l.3–84vb l.16) II) Bäsǝmä ʾǝgziʾabǝḥer qädamawi zä-ʾǝnbälä tǝmalǝm wä-maʾǝkälawi zäʾǝnbälä yom wä-dä[ḫa]rawi zäʾǝnbälä geśäm... (“In the name of God, the First One without yesterday, the Middle One without today, the Last One without tomorrow...”) – prayer to God for protection (fols. 85ra l.1–86vb l.10) III) Täfäśśǝḥi Maryam lä-ʾAdam fasikahu... “Rejoice, Mary, Adam’s pasch...” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 86vb l.11–89vb l.16), incomplete, end missing (s. GrohHymn 36)
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: Kǝflä Śǝllase (hand a; s. fol. 3ra, l.12).

donors.donor: Gäbrä Dǝngǝl mentioned throughout Text I and in the prayer (Text II, fol. 86v).

txstates.txstate: The front board is missing. The leather cover is torn off from the back board (only tunr-ins are preserved). Many fols. are damaged by humidity. Fol. 90 is mutilated.

bindings.binding: Tow wooden boards (front board is missing) covered with reddish-brown leather (the leather cover is preserved only on the inner side of the back board); crude textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes or tears are visible on the spine folds of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex. The turn-ins are laced with cords.

squires.squire:
I(fols. 1r-9v) – II(fols. 10r-16v) – III(fols. 17r-20v) – IV(fols. 21r-28v) – V(fols. 29r-36v) – VI(fols. 37r-43v) – VII(fols. 44r-51v) – VIII(fols. 52r-61v) – IX(fols. 62r-71v) – X(fols. 72r-81v) – XI(fols. 82r-89v)
Fol. 7 does not belong to quire I, its proper place is between fols. 36 and 37. Fol. 43 is a single folio torn off from quire VI. Fol. 90 is a single folio attached to quire XI. S. also below, "Other details".

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are mostly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 73r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 57r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are mostly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 73r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 57r). Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre. Hand b: mediocre, but better than hand a.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 1r-20ra (with the exception of fol. 7), 39va–84vb. Hand b: fols. 21r-39va, l.3; fol. 7. Hand c: fols. 85ra–89vb (Texts II and III; may be identical with hand a, but much less careful, deteriorating to the end of the text).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; first words (headings or parts of headings) of constituent texts; names of the commissioner and the scribe; the word እማሬ፡; abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይቤ፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይቤ፡ ሕዝብ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail:
The text in the Ms. is written at least by two scribes, with very different (hand b shows clear Gondärine influence), but perhaps at the same time (otherwise fols. with the text by hand b may be somewhat older). The Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug is written in hand a, but its ʾAnbǝro ʾǝd is added in hand a.
Some of the signs above the text are written in blue or rosy ink (e.g., fols. 21ra, 40ra, 47vb, 58rb).

additional.cont: Fol. 20v: Unidentified prayer.

extras.extra: - Fols. 1vb, 2ra, 2rb: Parts of text are written between the lines in smaller letters. On fol. 2ra four lines have been deleted and dashes put in their place. - Fol. 7r: Note in the upper margin. - Fol. 20r: Note in the upper margin, in red. The Communion hymn “Śärawitä mälaʾǝktihu”, in blue pencil, is added after Text I-2. - Fol. 32r: Note in the bottom margin. - Fols. 33r, 33v, 34r: Notes in the bottom margin: ሃለቃገብረሚካኤል.
